column2: n. (Greek mythology) the beautiful daughter of Zeus and Leda who was abducted by Paris; the Greek army sailed to Troy to get her back which resulted in the Trojan War
n device for converting sound waves into electrical energy
n. the time period between dawn and noon
n. the part of the day between noon and evening

n. the latter part of the day (the period of decreasing daylight from late afternoon until nightfall)
n. a later concluding time period
n. the early part of night (from dinner until bedtime) spent in a special way
n. an informal term for a father; probably derived from baby talk

n. secrecy
s. failing to speak or communicate etc when expected to

n. a person whose occupation is teaching
n. a personified abstraction that teaches

prep. & adv. Near.
v. t. & i. To near; to approach.

n. a score in baseball made by a runner touching all four bases safely
n. (American football) a play in which a player attempts to carry the ball through or past the opposing team
n. a regular trip
n. the act of running; traveling on foot at a fast pace

n. a sudden and decisive increase
n. (film) an abrupt transition from one scene to another
n. descent with a parachute
n. the act of jumping; propelling yourself off the ground

v. deliver by singing
v. produce tones with the voice
v. to make melodious sounds

n. an artistic form of nonverbal communication
n. a party of people assembled for dancing
n. a party for social dancing
v. move in a graceful and rhythmical way

n. red color or pigment; the chromatic color resembling the hue of blood
n. a tributary of the Mississippi River that flows eastward from Texas along the southern boundary of Oklahoma and through Louisiana
s. of a color at the end of the color spectrum (next to orange); resembling the color of blood or cherries or tomatoes or rubies

n. green color or pigment; resembling the color of growing grass
n. United States labor leader who was president of the American Federation of Labor from 1924 to 1952 and who led the struggle with the Congress of Industrial Organizations (1873-1952)
n. an environmentalist who belongs to the Green Party
n. a river that rises in western Wyoming and flows southward through Utah to become a tributary of the Colorado River

n. blue color or pigment; resembling the color of the clear sky in the daytime
n. blue clothing
n. any organization or party whose uniforms or badges are blue
n. any of numerous small butterflies of the family Lycaenidae

n. yellow color or pigment; the chromatic color resembling the hue of sunflowers or ripe lemons
v. turn yellow
s. of the color intermediate between green and orange in the color spectrum; of something resembling the color of an egg yolk
s. changed to a yellowish color by age

n. an orange of low brightness and saturation
n. Scottish botanist who first observed the movement of small particles in fluids now known a Brownian motion (1773-1858)
n. abolitionist who was hanged after leading an unsuccessful raid at Harper's Ferry, Virginia (1800-1859)
v. fry in a pan until it changes color
